{{distinguish|José de Alencar}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2011}} {{Infobox vice president | honorific-prefix = [[Excellency|His Excellency]] | name = José Alencar | image = Jose de alencar 23 out 2007.jpg | order = 23rd | office = Vice President of Brazil | term_start = 1 January 2003 | term_end = 31 December 2010 | president = [[Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva]] | predecessor = [[Marco Maciel]] | successor = [[Michel Temer]] | office2 = [[Ministry of Defence (Brazil)|Minister of Defence]] | term_start2 = 8 November 2004 | term_end2 = 31 March 2006 | president2 = [[Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva]] | predecessor2 = [[José Viegas Filho]] | successor2 = [[Waldir Pires]] | order3 = [[Federal Senate (Brazil)|Senator]] for [[Minas Gerais]] | term_start3 = 1 February 1999 | term_end3 = 14 December 2002 | birth_name = José Alencar Gomes da Silva | birth_date = {{birth date|df=yes|1931|10|17}} | birth_place = [[Muriaé]], [[Brazil]] | death_date = {{death date and age|df=yes|2011|3|29|1931|10|17}} | death_place = [[São Paulo]], Brazil | spouse = {{marriage|Mariza Oliveira Campos|9 November 1957}} | party = [[Brazilian Democratic Movement Party|PMDB]] (1993–2002)
[[Liberal Party (Brazil)|PL]] (2002–2005)
[[Brazilian Republican Party|PRB]] (2005–2011) | children = Maria da Graça
Patrícia
Josué | residence = [[Palácio do Jaburu|Jaburu Palace]] (2003–2011) | alma_mater = | occupation = Businessman {{•}} politician }} '''José Alencar Gomes da Silva''' ({{IPA-pt|ʒuˈzɛ ɐlẽˈkaʁ ˈɡõmiz dɐ ˈsiɫvɐ}}; 17 October 1931 – 29 March 2011) was a [[Brazilian people|Brazilian]] businessman and politician who served as the [[Vice President of Brazil]] from 1 January 2003 to 31 December 2010. In business from a young age, Alencar became a self-made multimillionaire as the chief executive of [[Coteminas]], a leading [[textile manufacturer]]. In the 1990s, Alencar groomed his son to succeed him at the company. He opted to enter politics in his home state, [[Minas Gerais]].{{cite web | url=http://www1.folha.uol.com.br/mercado/592936-fundada-por-alencar-coteminas-e-uma-das-maiores-empresas-texteis-do-pais.shtml | title=Fundada por Alencar, Coteminas é uma das maiores empresas têxteis do país | accessdate=29 March 2011 | date=23 July 2010 | publisher=[[Folha de S. Paulo]] | language=Portuguese}} Alencar had a business-oriented political platform, advocating [[market liberalization]] and [[deregulation]] of [[Production (economics)|production]]. His expensive political campaigns received hefty funds from Coteminas. After a failed run in 1994 for governor of Minas Gerais, he won the election in 1998 as Senator representing his home state. In 2002, Alencar was invited by the left-wing [[Workers' Party (Brazil)|Workers' Party]] to run for Vice President on the same ticket as [[Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva]]. The alliance between the leftist union leader and Alencar, an experienced entrepreneur, proved successful. They won the presidential elections in [[Brazilian presidential election, 2002|2002]] and were re-elected in [[Brazilian presidential election, 2006|2006]]. Over the years, Lula da Silva and Alencar developed a close and affectionate friendship. Diagnosed with cancer of the [[stomach cancer|stomach]] and [[kidney cancer|kidney]] in 1997, Alencar died of the disease in 2011. Alencar came to be revered among journalists and politicians for his spirited personality and friendly demeanor. He overcame his lack of formal education. Based on his business success, he argued in favor of lower taxes, especially [[indirect taxation]] over consumers, and a simpler [[tax system]]; lower [[interest rates]] and greater oversight of the [[banking industry]]; and [[social welfare]] and assistance programs. As Vice President, Alencar sometimes spoke out against his own government's [[orthodox economics|orthodox policies]], causing embarrassment for fellow administration members.{{cite web | url=http://veja.abril.com.br/280503/p_042.html | title=O vice que ruge | accessdate=31 March 2011 | date=28 May 2003| publisher=[[Veja (magazine)|Veja]] | language=Portuguese| author=Maurício Lima}} His unwavering determination to live in the face of terminal cancer also marked public perception, during and after his time in office. ==Personal life and early political career== [[File:José Alencar e Dom Freire Falcão.jpg|thumb|left|Alencar [[Hand-kissing|kissing the hand]] of Cardinal [[Freire Falcão]], the archbishop of [[Brasília]]|200px]] Alencar was born into a family of small entrepreneurs from [[Muriaé]], in the inland state of [[Minas Gerais]] on 17 October 1931. He was the eleventh son of Antônio Gomes da Silva and Dolores Peres Gomes da Silva. As a child, he was a [[Boy Scout]]. He started working while still a child, dropping out of primary school to help his father in the family business. He worked with his older brothers for years before becoming an independent successful businessman.[http://www.escoteiros.org.br/noticias/noticia_detalhe.php?id=159], ''Escoteiros'' For a time he worked as a [[:wikt:travelling salesman|travelling salesman]] and in [[food industry|food]] wholesale start-ups. ==Marriage and family== After getting established, Alencar married Mariza Gomes in 1957. They had three children together. Their two daughters are Maria da Graça and Patrícia. Their son Josué took over the presidency of Coteminas after his father went into politics. As a result of a case filed by Rosemary de Morais, a 55-year-old retired teacher, in July 2010 the court ruled that Alencar needed to recognize her as his daughter. (The case may be appealed.){{cite web | url=http://oglobo.globo.com/pais/mat/2010/07/22/justica-determina-que-vice-presidente-jose-alencar-reconheca-paternidade-917221984.asp | title=Justiça determina que vice-presidente José Alencar reconheça paternidade | accessdate=29 March 2011 | date=22 July 2010 | publisher=[[O Globo]] | language=Portuguese | author=Marcelo Portela}}{{cite web | url=http://odia.terra.com.br/portal/brasil/html/2010/7/juiz_determina_que_alencar_reconheca_filha_de_55_anos_98207.html | title=Juiz determina que Alencar reconheça filha de 55 anos (Justice rules that Alencar recognize his daughter of 55 years) | accessdate=29 March 2011 | date=23 July 2010 | publisher=[[O Dia]] | language=Portuguese | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100726225711/http://odia.terra.com.br/portal/brasil/html/2010/7/juiz_determina_que_alencar_reconheca_filha_de_55_anos_98207.html | archivedate=26 July 2010 | df=dmy-all }} He had refused to undergo [[DNA testing]] but, according to [[Brazilian law]] 12.004/2009,{{cite web | url=http://www.planalto.gov.br/ccivil_03/_Ato2007-2010/2009/Lei/L12004.htm | title=LEI Nº 12.004, DE 29 DE JULHO DE 2009. | accessdate=16 April 2011 | date=29 July 2009 | publisher=[[President of Brazil]] | language=Portuguese | author=[[Tarso Genro]]}} this refusal is accepted as evidence of [[Paternity (law)|paternity]]. In addition, the judge ruled that other evidence in the case led him to his decision.{{cite web | url=http://oglobo.globo.com/pais/mat/2009/07/30/lula-sanciona-lei-de-presuncao-da-paternidade-recusa-em-fazer-dna-se-torna-prova-757047344.asp | title=Lula sanciona lei de presunção de paternidade. Recusa em fazer DNA se torna prova. | accessdate=16 April 2011 | date=30 July 2009 | publisher=[[O Globo]] | language=Portuguese }} Rosemary de Morais said she was the child of Francisca de Morais, a nurse, and Alencar, from a relationship they had in 1954, before either was married. The legal case over Morais' parentage is still ongoing, as there are some appeal rights. ==Career== [[File:José Alencar e Lula.JPG|thumb|250px|right|Alencar (right) with [[President Lula]].]] Alencar eventually turned his family's small clothes factory and retail store into a major business. In 1967, he founded [[Coteminas]], which he would lead to become one of Brazil's largest textile manufacturers.{{cite web | url=http://noticias.uol.com.br/politica/2011/03/29/dono-da-coteminas-alencar-ajudou-lula-a-superar-resistencia-do-empresariado.jhtm | title=Dono da Coteminas, Alencar ajudou Lula a superar resistência do empresariado | accessdate=29 March 2011 | date=29 March 2011 | publisher=[[Universo Online]] | language=Portuguese}} He produced goods for traditional brands in its portfolio, such as Artex, Santista and Calfat. He vied for dominance of the global market after a merger with [[South Carolina]]-based [[Springs Industries]]. After decades as a businessman, Alencar decided to enter politics and prepared his son to take over his leadership of Coteminas. He ran for governor of Minas Gerais in 1994. Although he was not successful, in 1998 he was elected as Senator from Minas Gerais. While in the Senate, Alencar worked on several Commissions, including the Senatorial Commission for Economic and Social Matters. In 2002, he left the presidency of his company, by then a leading player with roughly 850 million [[Brazilian real|reais]] in yearly [[net sales]], to his son Josué Gomes da Silva. Alencar ran for Vice President of Brazil, tapped to be Lula's running mate, to assuage worries about the candidate's alleged anti-business bias.{{cite web | url=http://exame.abril.com.br/revista-exame/edicoes/0924/noticias/ele-nao-esta-mais-sozinho-m0165419 | title=Ele não está mais sozinho | accessdate=29 March 2011 | date=7 August 2008 | publisher=[[Exame]] | language=Portuguese | author=Larissa Santana | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110719173126/http://exame.abril.com.br/revista-exame/edicoes/0924/noticias/ele-nao-esta-mais-sozinho-m0165419 | archivedate=19 July 2011 | df=dmy-all }}{{cite web | url=http://www.coteminas.com.br/scripts/cgiip.exe/WService=ciatecidos/ciatec/ing/ri/invatu.htm | title=Coteminas Investor Relations | accessdate=29 March 2011 | publisher=[[Coteminas]] }} He became the honorary President of the center-right [[Liberal Party (Brazil)|Liberal Party]]. At the end of 2005, Alencar left his party to associate with the new [[Brazilian Republican Party]], whose founders included Bishop [[Marcelo Crivella]] of the [[Universal Church of the Kingdom of God]], a large and growing evangelical church in Brazil and other countries. Crivella is also a Senator representing Rio de Janeiro in the federal government. ==Vice Presidency (2003-2010)== [[File:Alencar speech.jpg|thumb|left|Alencar giving a speech on [[women's rights]] at the Palácio do Planalto]] In office, Alencar aligned with another successful businessman in the cabinet, Luiz Fernando Furlan, to channel the demands of Brazilian businessmen. They voiced discontent with bureaucracy, insufficient infrastructure and cautious [[monetary policy]]. His efforts led to the strengthening of Apex-Brasil, a pro-export agency seen as instrumental in the [[Economy of Brazil|Brazilian economy]]'s recent rise in exports.{{cite web | url=http://www.diariosp.com.br/_conteudo/2011/03/51608-a+despedida+do+guerreiro.html | title=A despedida do guerreiro | accessdate= 31 March 2011 | date=30 March 2011 | publisher=[[Diário de S. Paulo]] | language=Portuguese| author=Juan Quirós}} [[File:Lula's presidential inauguration, 2007.jpg|thumb|250px|President Lula and Vice President Alencar in their second [[Brazilian presidential inauguration|inauguration]] ceremony, walking into [[Palácio do Planalto]] (Planalto Palace), on January 1, 2007.]] Alencar was the most notable person in government to openly complain of the [[Fiscal conservatism|conservative]] monetary policies of the [[Brazilian Central Bank]], under [[Henrique Meirelles]], backed by ministers [[Antonio Palocci]] and [[Paulo Bernardo]]. He often criticized his own administration for failing to lower the Central Bank's [[Bank base rate|base interest rates]] and demanded a reform of the country's tax system. In November 2004 he was sworn in as [[Ministry of Defence (Brazil)|Defense Minister]], following the resignation of [[José Viegas Filho]]. Lula turned to him to occupy the position. Alencar tried to resign on several occasions, claiming that a businessman would hardly be the best choice for running a nation's [[Military of Brazil|military forces]]. President Lula convinced him to stay until March 2006, when Alencar resigned his ministerial post, in favor of anti-graft activist [[Waldir Pires]].{{cite web | url=http://oglobo.globo.com/pais/mat/2011/03/29/alencar-critico-da-politica-economica-de-lula-empresario-de-sucesso-924115902.asp | title=Alencar, crítico da política econômica de Lula e empresário de sucesso | accessdate=29 March 2011 | date= 31 March 2006 | publisher=[[O Globo]] | language=Portuguese| author=Giancarlo Lepiani}}{{cite web | url=http://noticias.terra.com.br/brasil/interna/0,,OI943803-EI1194,00.html | title=Governo anuncia nome de cinco novos ministros | accessdate=29 March 2011 | date=31 March 2006 | publisher=Terra | language=Portuguese| author=Giancarlo Lepiani}} Despite his disagreements with some policies of the [[Lula administration]], Alencar was officially invited by Lula to be his running mate in the [[Brazilian general elections, 2006|2006 general elections]]. With Lula's re-election victory on 29 October, Alencar secured his position as Vice President for another term. Alencar adopted a lower tone, while still espousing his traditional positions. He sought to run for the Senate in 2010, but was forced to give up due to the advanced stage of his cancer disease. ==Disease and death== [[File:Alencar com Dilma e Lula no Sírio-Libanês.jpg|thumb|left|Alencar, visited by Presidents Lula and Rousseff, receiving anticancer treatment at [[Sírio-Libanês Hospital]] in São Paulo, December 23, 2010.]] On a routine [[check-up]], José Alencar was diagnosed with [[stomach cancer|stomach]] and [[kidney cancer]] in 1997. After undergoing treatment for some length of time, he had his right kidney and two-thirds of his stomach surgically removed. Five years later, a malignant tumor in his [[prostate]] was removed. As the disease had [[metastasized]], it continued to spread, and in 2006 doctors discovered a [[sarcoma]] in his [[abdomen]]. On 26 January 2009, a surgery extirpated eight tumors, along with compromised portions of his [[small intestine|small]] and [[large intestine]]s and the [[ureter]]s.{{double image|right|Jose Alencar Velorio1.jpg|200|José Alencar velório.jpg|200|An honor guard carrying the casket of José Alencar up the ramp of the [[Planalto Palace]] in [[Brasília]], March 30, 2011.|Alencar lying in state in the Noble Room of the Planalto Palace. From left to right: the widow Mariza, their son Josué, then-President [[Dilma Rousseff]], former President Lula and the former First Lady [[Marisa Letícia]] (kissing Alencar).}} He was treated for [[digestive hemorrhage]] in December 2010 with urgent surgery, his last as Vice President. Doctors could not remove the tumors in his abdomen because of the number of operations to which he had already been subjected – eighteen in all. Alencar received [[chemotherapy]] for many years. He was mostly treated at [[Hospital Sírio-Libanês]], in [[São Paulo]]. He also received experimental treatment at the [[M.D. Anderson Cancer Center]] in [[Houston]], Texas.{{cite web | url=http://terramagazine.terra.com.br/interna/0,,OI5035001-EI6578,00-Alencar+passou+anos+lutando+contra+o+cancer.html | title=Alencar passou 13 anos lutando contra o câncer | accessdate=31 March 2011 | date=29 March 2011 | publisher=Terra | language=Portuguese |author=Dayanne Sousa}}{{cite web | url=http://www1.folha.uol.com.br/poder/591407-acompanhe-a-evolucao-da-doenca-de-jose-alencar.shtml | title=Acompanhe a evolução da doença de José Alencar | accessdate=31 March 2011 | date=29 March 2011 | publisher=[[Folha de S. Paulo]] | language=Portuguese }}{{cite web | url=http://www1.folha.uol.com.br/poder/849878-cirurgia-de-alencar-termina-sem-retirada-de-tumor-que-provoca-hemorragia.shtml | title=Cirurgia de Alencar termina sem retirada de tumor que provoca hemorragia | accessdate= 31 March 2011 | date=22 December 2010 | publisher=[[Folha de S. Paulo]] | language=Portuguese |author=Fernando Galloanna, Virginia Balloussier}} Alencar died in late March 2011, in the city of [[São Paulo]], after 13 years battling metastasized cancer.{{cite web | url=http://g1.globo.com/politica/noticia/2011/03/ex-vice-presidente-jose-alencar-morre-aos-79-anos.html | title=Ex-vice-presidente José Alencar morre aos 79 anos | accessdate= 29 March 2011 | date=29 March 2011 | publisher=G1 | language=Portuguese }} His death was met with expressions of grief and respect by members of different institutions and across the political spectrum{{cite web | url=http://g1.globo.com/politica/noticia/2011/03/veja-repercussao-sobre-morte-de-jose-alencar.html | title=Veja repercussão sobre a morte de José Alencar | accessdate=29 March 2011 | date=29 March 2011 | publisher=G1 | language=Portuguese }} – former President Lula said he knew "few men with José Alencar's goodness and spirit"{{cite web | url=http://g1.globo.com/politica/noticia/2011/03/lula-se-emociona-e-chora-ao-falar-da-morte-de-jose-alencar.html | title=Lula se emociona e chora ao falar da morte de José Alencar | accessdate=29 March 2011 | date=29 March 2011 | publisher=G1 | language=Portuguese |author=Natasha Bin}} and [[President Rousseff]] said it was an "honor" to have served alongside him.{{cite web | url=http://g1.globo.com/politica/noticia/2011/03/dilma-diz-que-velorio-de-alencar-sera-no-palacio-do-planalto.html | title=Dilma diz que velório de Alencar será no Palácio do Planalto | accessdate=29 March 2011 | date=29 March 2011 | publisher=G1 | language=Portuguese |author=Natasha Bin}} Brazil held a [[state funeral]] for José Alencar, and Vice President [[Michel Temer]] decreed seven days of [[official mourning]].{{cite web | url=http://revistaepoca.globo.com/Revista/Epoca/0,,EMI222032-15223,00.html | title=Temer decreta luto oficial de sete dias pela morte de José Alencar | accessdate=31 March 2011 | date=29 March 2011 | work=[[Época (Brazilian magazine)|Época]]| language=Portuguese }} Alencar is remembered as an honest and independent politician who favored [[social welfare]] and [[economic freedom]]. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Portal|Brazil|Biography}} {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{s-bef|before=[[Marco Maciel]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Vice President of Brazil]]|years=2003–2010}} {{Infobox non-profit | name = Koreatown Immigrant Workers Alliance (KIWA, 한인타운 노동연대) | type = Non-Profit Organization | founded_date = 1992 | location = 3465 West 8th St. Los Angeles, CA 90005 | area_served = Koreatown, Los Angeles | homepage = {{URL|http://kiwa.org}} }}
The '''Koreatown Immigrant Workers Alliance 한인타운 노동연대''' ('''KIWA''', pronounced kee-wah), also known under its past name '''Korean Immigrant Workers Advocates 남가주 한인 노동 상담소''', is a multi-ethnic [[foreign worker|immigrant worker]] [[civil rights]] [[membership organization]] based in the [[Los Angeles]] [[Koreatown, Los Angeles, California|Koreatown]] area.
KIWA was founded in 1992 by progressive minded Korean activists who saw [[social class|class]] as the basic contradiction of the immigrant communities in [[Koreatown, Los Angeles, California|Koreatown]]. It has since been involved in the aftermath of the [[1992 Los Angeles Civil Unrest]], campaigns to improve working conditions and immigrant worker empowerment in various Korean ethnic industries, the [[living wage]]s campaign, and Koreatown's multi-ethnic community developments.
KIWA is perhaps best known recently for its long campaign against Assi Market, the largest ethnic Korean-owned supermarket of the [[United States]], located in Koreatown. Started in the late 1990s, KIWA demands that Assi management rehire dozens of fired [[Latino]] and [[Korean people|Korean]] workers who were fired for trying to organize a [[trade union]].
Although initially staffed mostly by ethnic Koreans, KIWA grew to encompass [[Asian-Pacific American]] and [[Latino]] organizers and members. The [[Spanish language]] "''Alianza de trabajadores inmigrantes del Barrio Coreano''" had been in common use since the early 2000s; however the [[English language]] name was officially changed in March 2006 from ''Korean Immigrant Workers Advocates'' to ''Koreatown Immigrant Workers Alliance''. The [[Korean language]] "한인노동상담소" (Korean Worker's Center) has been changed to 한인타운 노동연대 to signify its geographical focus rather than on an ethnic group.
KIWA is a member organization of [http://www.miwon.org MIWON (Multi-Ethnic Immigrant Workers Alliance] [http://www.miwon.org]), an alliance of four (formerly five) immigrant workers' centers in the [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles]] area, and [[ENLACE]], a U.S.-[[Mexico]] network of [[Worker center|workers' centers]].
==References== *Cho, Namju. "Check Out, Not In: Koreana Wilshire/Hyatt Takeover and the Los Angeles Korean Community." ''Amerasia Journal.'' 18:1 (1992). *Doherty, Jack. "Activists Train to Aid Korean Workers." ''Los Angeles Times.'' July 4, 1993. *Ha, Daisy. "An Analysis and Critique of KIWA's Reform Efforts in the Los Angeles Korean American Restaurant Industry." ''Asian Law Journal.'' 8:1 (May 2001). *Hong, Peter Y. "Working for Less." ''Los Angeles Times.'' May 7, 1995. *Lee, Hoon. "Displaced and Demanding Justice." ''Third Force.'' September/October 1994. *Lee, John. "Real Good Food at a Price." ''Gidra.'' Spring 1999. *Nguyen, Tram. "Showdown in K-town." ''ColorLines.'' Spring 2001. *Thornburg, Gina. "Koreatown's Workers Find a Voice." ''The Progressive.'' July 1998.

'''Lang Law''' is the informal name given to [[France|French]] law number 81-766, from 10 August 1981, relating to book prices. The law establishes a fixed price for books sold in France, limiting price discounts on them. The law is named after [[Jack Lang (French politician)|Jack Lang]], the French Minister of Culture at the time.
The Lang Law works as follows:
* The publisher decides on a price for its book and prints it on the back * Booksellers are not allowed to sell a book for a discount of more than 5% below the publisher's price.
The Lang Law was passed under pressure from small booksellers,{{citation needed|date=May 2012}} who feared competition from big stores.
Similar [[Fixed Book Price Law]]s exist in other countries, namely [[Austria]], [[Denmark]], [[Germany]], [[Greece]], [[Hungary]], [[Italy]], [[The Netherlands]], [[Portugal]], and [[Spain]].
In other cases, the book price is kept fixed by an [[Fixed Book Price Agreement|agreement]] between the publishers and the booksellers. This was the case of the [[Net Book Agreement]] in the [[United Kingdom]].
The Lang Law was extended to cover [[e-books]] in May 2011.

International Herald Tribune, January 14, 2008] *[http://www.legifrance.gouv.fr/affichTexte.do?cidTexte=JORFTEXT000000517179 Loi n°81-766 du 10 août 1981 relative au prix du livre] *[https://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/news/2011/05/france-attempts-to-impose-e-book-prices-on-apple-others.ars France attempts to impose e-book prices on Apple, others]

{|{{Infobox ship begin |display title=ital}} {{Infobox ship image | Ship image = | Ship caption = }} {{Infobox ship career | Ship registry =*{{LBR}} (1975–1985) *{{VCT}} (1985–1996) | Ship name =*'''''Main Ore''''' (1985–1996) *'''''Mary R. Koch''''' (1975–1985) | Ship owner =*VALECO tankers CORP. *First Trust Co of Saint Paul *Mansfield Sg Co Ltd | Ship operator = Dorian Hellas SA (1979–1985)<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.dorianhellas.com/old_vessels.asp |title=Dorian previously operated Ships |accessdate=2 September 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100826063746/http://www.dorianhellas.com/old_vessels.asp |archivedate=26 August 2010 |df= }}</ref> | Ship completed = 04.1975 | Ship out of service = 1996 | Ship fate = Scrapped at [[Alang]] 09.06.1997 | Ship builder =*[[Uljanik]], Brodogradiliste l Tvornica Dizel Motora *[[Pula]], [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]], (now [[Croatia]]) | Ship identification =*DNV ID: *{{IMO Number|7391458}} | Ship yard number = 303 | Ship notes = <ref name="aukevisser">{{Cite web |url=http://www.aukevisser.nl/supertankers/bulkers/id374.htm |title=Mary R. Koch |work=Auke Visser's International Super Tankers |accessdate=2 September 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101229014237/http://www.aukevisser.nl/supertankers/bulkers/id374.htm |archivedate=29 December 2010 |df= }}</ref> }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Ship displacement =*??? long tons light ship *274.330 long tons full load |Ship tonnage =*{{GT|136,991}} *120,376 NT |Ship cargo capacity = ?? million bbls. |Ship length = {{convert|335.0|m|ft|2|abbr=on}} |Ship beam = {{convert|52.20|m|ft|2|abbr=on}} |Ship draught = {{convert|21.794|m|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship depth = {{convert|28.00|m|ft|2|abbr=on}} |Ship propulsion = [[Burmeister & Wain]] |Ship capacity = {{DWT|264,999}} |Ship horsepower = 29422 kW |Ship speed = 16.5 knots |Ship range = |Ship class = |Ship notes = <ref name="aukevisser" /> }} |} The '''''Mary R. Koch''''' was a 274.330 Mt combined [[Bulk carrier|ore carrier]] and [[oil tanker]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Koch Industries, Inc. |work=Lehman Brothers Collection |url=http://www.library.hbs.edu/hc/lehman/query.html?company=koch_industries_inc&deal=1 |accessdate=September 2, 2010}}</ref> The ship was named after Mary Robinson Koch, wife of American industrialist [[Fred C. Koch]].<ref>{{Cite journal |title=The Koch Bros. and Corporate Welfare |author=Yasha Levine |journal=[[The New York Observer]] |date=September 1, 2010 |url=http://www.observer.com/2010/slideshow/131739/communist-shipbuilding |accessdate=September 2, 2010}}</ref>
The ''Mary R. Koch'' was built at the [[Uljanik]], Brodogradiliste l Tvornica Dizel Motora shipyard in [[Pula]] in [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia]], (now [[Croatia]]).<ref name="Reference list">{{Cite web |title=Uljanik – Reference list |url=http://www.hb.hr/shipyards_uljanik_reference2.htm |publisher=CROATIAN SHIPBUILDING CORPORATION |accessdate=September 2, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100923093621/http://hb.hr/shipyards_uljanik_reference2.htm |archivedate=September 23, 2010 |df= }}</ref> Her two sister ships, the ''Tafala'' and the ''Torne'' were delivered to the Swedish company Trafikaktiebolaget Grengesberg in 1974.<ref name="Reference list" /> A further sister-ship named Kanchenjunga was built as a pure oil carrier with no ore capability.
Under Greek management the Mary R. Koch (callsign A8QU) was time-chartered to Exxon for three years from going into service. Subsequently she made spot voyages arranged by the oil-trading division of Koch Industries. Around 1980 Koch Shipping was created and the Mary R. Koch was managed directly from Wichita, with officers and crew being supplied by an agency in [[Piraeus]]. Due to severe corrosion problems with piping in the 'void space' double bottom the ship transferred to the bulk-ore trade in the early 80s.
The four ships of this design were built to prove the practicality of the [[Kamewa|KaMeWa]] variable pitch propellor system in high SHP applications. Although the system did function well the high initial and subsequent maintenance costs associated with having two 20,000 HP B&W diesel engines, together with the inferior steel used for the cargo piping, compounded by the depressed tanker market at the time, meant that they were never viable economically.

{{Orphan|date=August 2013}} The '''Micro-MBA''' is a learner-driven, outcomes-based entrepreneurial course based on classroom session followed by pro-active mentoring meetings. The programme aims to teach entrepreneurs, mostly in developing countries, fundamental business skills thus they can operate their businesses successfully. The term ''Micro-MBA'' refers to the traditional [[Master of Business Administration|Master of Business Administration (MBA)]] programme. There is no official definition for the term Micro-MBA. The course programme focuses on teaching theory about subjects as money management, stock control, customer handling, and marketing that can be applied in the daily business activities of the business owners.
==Objective== The main aim of the Micro-MBA programme is to provide small business owners with basic business skills, which they can apply in their daily activities to grow and sustain their businesses. Furthermore, it is supposed to empower them to become self-employed.
==History== <!-- Deleted image removed: [[File:Cedric Buffler.jpg|thumb|right|Micro-MBA CEO, Cedric Buffler with the founder of the World Economic Forum, Dr Klaus Schwab. The picture was taken at a press conference in Cape Town in June 2007.]] -->
The [[Wikiversity:Micro-MBA project|Trident Institute]] offered the first Micro-MBA programme in 1988 and it was aimed at business owners who had limited access to further education in South Africa. The programme focuses on teaching students basic business skills in class and mentoring sessions after completing the classes at their marketplaces. The main aim of the course has been to enable small business owners to operate their businesses more successfully or to start their own business. Since its formation more than 160,000 people have successfully completed the Micro-MBA course, which has been offered by some 250 organisations who have had their trainers trained by Trident Institute. Different surveys have shown that between 67% and 81% of former programme students are still successful with their own business or participating in the labour market 18 months after completing the course.<ref>[[Wikiversity:Micro-MBA project]]</ref> The programme has become a successful education tool in basic economic development in South Africa and has spread to other African and Asian countries. The course has been described by the [[Financial Times|London Financial Times]] as ''"Brilliantly Simple and Simply Brilliant!"''.<ref>{{cite news|title=This course is Brilliantly Simple and Simply Brilliant!|url=http://www.micro-mba.com/|accessdate=7 August 2013|newspaper=London Financial Times|date=August 1991|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130727021912/http://www.micro-mba.com/|archivedate=27 July 2013|df=}}</ref> The founder and CEO of Trident Institute, [http://www.moneyweb.co.za/moneyweb-safm-market-update/cedric-buffler-ceo-micromba Cedric Buffler], won the award for [http://www.schwabfound.org/content/global-selection Outstanding Social Entrepreneur] for 2007 by the [http://www.schwabfound.org/ Schwab Foundation]. The Micro-MBA has not only spread from South Africa to neighbouring African countries (Swaziland, Lesotho, Namibia, Zambia, Kenya, Ghana and Nigeria) but also to Asia and South America. Characteristic of these markets is that poor people with small businesses do not have access to supportive business theory and knowledge.
==Admission criteria== Most organizations that offer Micro-MBA are founded or sponsored by [[Nonprofit Organization]]s. Admissions criteria vary. But mostly it is generally required that participants already have an existing business or a business idea that they want to realize after the course. No specific academic qualifications are required. The most important requirements are high motivation levels and the will to apply the learning to their businesses. Interviews are conducted before choosing applicants to guarantee that they take the opportunity serious. Most of the courses are free of charge but this depends on the programme, course design, and the organization.
==Course design and structure== Micro-MBA is an outcomes-based, learner-driven course. The classroom learning takes about 35 hours to complete and this is followed by a period of mentoring. This varies, depending on the requirements set by the implementing organisation. The duration of the courses varies from three weeks of classes combined with nine months of mentoring training to three months of classes with additional mentoring training. Facilitators are trained by Trident Institute and are typically business owners or trainers employed by community-based organisations. Mentoring and coaching, in terms of visiting students at their marketplace, after the course, ensures the long-term success of the programme. The course materials are simple as e.g. workbooks and calculators. The course comprises 8 simple workbooks, which are accessible to persons with a grade 6 level of literacy: * Market Investigation * Business calculations on a simple calculator * Buying * Costing and Pricing * Selling * Money Management * Stock Control
Workbooks and bookkeeping materials are available in three variants, for Traders, Producers and Service `providers. Facilitators are trained to offer all three options. Only organisations that have had their facilitators certificated by ~Trident institute are permitted to purchase training materials.
==See also== * [[Mini-MBA]]
'''Organizations offering Micro-MBAs''' * [https://web.archive.org/web/20130727021912/http://www.micro-mba.com/ Micro-MBA] - Micro-MBA, [https://archive.is/20130809181246/http://capetownchamber.com/company/trident-institute/ Trident Institute], South Africa * [https://web.archive.org/web/20130730050729/http://www.usb.ac.za/AboutUs/SmallBusinessAcademy.aspx Small Business Academy] - [[University of Stellenbosch Business School]], South Africa * [http://www.thembalitsha.org.za/#!themba-training/cdir Themba Training ] – Micro-MBA, [http://www.thembalitsha.org.za/ Thembalitsha], South Africa * [http://www.seda.org.za/Pages/Home.aspx/ Small enterprise development agency] – seda, South Africa * [http://thembatraining.blogspot.co.uk/ Themba Training Blog], South Africa
'''Accreditation''' * [http://www.serviceseta.org.za/Pages/home.aspx/cdir Services Sector Education & Training Authority] – Micro-MBA, [http://www.thembalitsha.org.za/ Thembalitsha], South Africa
'''Literature''' * [https://books.google.com/books/about/Hit_the_Ground_Running.html?id=VKUbygAACAAJ&redir_esc=y Hit the Ground Running - Doing Business Training in South Africa, Mark Waller], Publication on micro business development
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Business qualifications]]

[[File:محمدعلی سرلک 2.gpg.jpg|thumb|right|Prof.Mohammad Ali Sarlak]] ''' Mohammad Ali Sarlak''' (born March 25, 1970, Iran) is an International author and researcher.<ref>[https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Fx08B9MAAAAJ&hl=en Google Scholar list of publications by Mohammad Ali Sarlak and related citations]</ref> He is a [[professor]] of organizational behavior management at [[Payame Noor University]] (PNU), and current president of post graduate center of this university.<ref name="pnu.ac.ir">http://www.pnu.ac.ir/portal/Home/Default.aspx?CategoryID=90c596fd-f593-4b7b-a3a3-d4f54fa0f29f</ref> He is known for introducing new concept of [[the organization’s face]] in a multi volume book entitled:The new faces of organizations in the 21st century<ref>https://www.amazon.com/s/ref=dp_byline_sr_book_1?ie=UTF8&text=Mohammad+A.+Sarlak&search-alias=books&field-author=Mohammad+A.+Sarlak&sort=relevancerank</ref><ref name=sarlak2011>Sarlak, Mohammad. A. (2011). ''The New Faces of Organizations in the 21st Century (Volumes:1,2,3)''. Canada: NAISIT Publishers.</ref><ref name=sarlak2012>Sarlak, Mohammad. A. (2012). ''The New Faces of Organizations in the 21st Century (Volumes:4,5)''. Canada: NAISIT Publishers.</ref> and as well as for his role as past president of the [[Payame Noor University]] as one of the world's [[Mega Universities]]. [[File:Professor_Mohammad_Ali_Sarlak_-UNESCO_World_Summit-2015-Paris.jpg|thumb|right| Professor Mohammad Ali Sarlak-UNESCO World Summit-2015-Paris]]
==Education== Ph.D: Organizational Behavior Management, [[University of Tehran]], 2005.
M.B.A: [[University of Tehran]], 1995.
B.S: Business Administration, [[University of Tehran]], 1993.
==Ideas and Concepts== Much of prof. sarlak's works concentrated on Advancing the boundaries of management knowledge. Some of his new ideas and conceptualizations are as follows:
'''-''' [[The organization’s face]]
'''-''' The organizational Rip currents.<ref>https://jipa.ut.ac.ir/article_62176_en.html</ref>
'''-''' The Commotion–result Theory .<ref> http://journals.pnu.ac.ir/article_3622_4.html</ref> .<ref> https://www.omicsonline.org/open-access/identification-of-the-strategies-of-organizational-brawl-management-2162-6359-1000427.php?aid=89657</ref>
'''-''' Management by Reaction .<ref>http://upna.ir/?p=51303</ref>
'''-''' The organizational Climate Inversion .<ref> http://modamnet.com/product/%D9%88%D8%A7%D8%B1%D9%88%D9%86%DA%AF%DB%8C-%D8%AC%D9%88-%D8%B3%D8%A7%D8%B2%D9%85%D8%A7%D9%86%DB%8C/</ref>
'''-''' The Behavioral Entropy .<ref> http://www.iran-academy.org/%D9%85%D8%B7%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A8-%D8%A2%D9%85%D9%88%D8%B2%D8%B4%DB%8C/838-%DA%86%D8%B1%D8%A7-%D8%B1%D9%81%D8%AA%D8%A7%D8%B1-%DA%A9%D8%A7%D8%B1%DA%A9%D9%86%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%B3%D8%A7%D8%B2%D9%85%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%AA%D8%BA%DB%8C%DB%8C%D8%B1-%D9%85%DB%8C-%DA%A9%D9%86%D8%AF%D8%9F.html</ref>
'''-''' The organizational Life Expectancy .<ref> http://modamnet.com/product/%D8%A7%D9%85%DB%8C%D8%AF-%D8%A8%D9%87-%D8%B2%D9%86%D8%AF%DA%AF%DB%8C-%D8%B3%D8%A7%D8%B2%D9%85%D8%A7%D9%86%DB%8C/</ref>
==Positions== '''-''' President of [[Payame Noor University]] (PNU) (2014–2015).
'''-''' President of Post Graduate Center of [[Payame Noor University]] (2007–Present).<ref name="pnu.ac.ir"/>
'''-''' A member of Executive Committee of AAOU (Asian Association of Open Universities) in 2015 .<ref>http://aaou.ouhk.edu.hk/about.htm</ref>
'''-''' A board member of Iranian Academy of Management sciences (2016).<ref>http://www.iams.ir/fa/NewsDetails.aspx?NewsId=1038</ref>
'''-''' A member of the Central promotion Committee of the Ministry of Science ,Research and Technology (2015–present).<ref>http://www.irna.ir/fa/News/81610749/</ref>
'''-''' A member of the National Committee of UNESCO (2015–present).<ref>http://www.mehrnews.com/news/2896487</ref>
'''-''' The Establisher of a UNESCO Chair on Environmental Education <ref>http://iranunesco.ir/project/en/news/58/</ref>
'''-''' A member of policymaking and scientific council of Iran Inventions Grand Prize<ref>http://iigp.ir/en/ScientificBoard.aspx</ref>
==Journals Editor in chief== 1. Iranian journal of Management of public organizations <ref>http://ipom.journals.pnu.ac.ir</ref>(2013–present)
2. International Journal of the Academy of Organizational Behavior Management, CANADA<ref>http://www.iaobm.ca/journal</ref>(2012–2014).
3. International Journal of E-Entrepreneurship and Innovation (IJEEI), IGI, USA<ref>https://www.amazon.com/International-Journal-E-Entrepreneurship-Innovation-Mohammad/dp/1616929782</ref>(2010–2012).
==Published Books== 1. The New Faces of Organizations in the 21st Century (Volume 1), NAISIT, 2011, CANADA
2. The New Faces of Organizations in the 21st Century (Volume 2), NAISIT, 2011, CANADA
3. The New Faces of Organizations in the 21st Century (Volume 3) , NAISIT, 2011, CANADA
4. The New Faces of Organizations in the 21st Century (Volume 4) , NAISIT, 2012, CANADA
5. The New Faces of Organizations in the 21st Century (Volume 5) , NAISIT, 2012, CANADA
6. E-Banking and Emerging Multidisciplinary Processes, IGI,2011, USA.
7. Barriers of E-Commerce Acceptance in Export, LAMBERT,2011,USA.
8. The Emerging Faces of Organizations in the 21st Century (Volume 1),Knowledge Reference Publisher,2013,IRAN.
9. The Emerging Faces of Organizations in the 21st Century (Volume 2),Knowledge Reference Publisher,2013,IRAN.
10. The Emerging Faces of Organizations in the 21st Century (Volume 3),Knowledge Reference Publisher,2013,IRAN.
11. The Emerging Faces of Organizations in the 21st Century (Volume 4),Knowledge Reference Publisher,2013,IRAN.
12. The organizations in knowledge Era ,Payame Noor Publisher,edition2,2012,IRAN.
13. Advanced Management Information Systems, Payame Noor Publisher, edition2. , 2011,IRAN.
14. Healthy Organization in Practice, Knowledge Reference Publisher,2014,IRAN.
15. E-Government, Knowledge Reference Publisher,2013,IRAN.
16. Managing Organizational trauma, Mir Mah Press,2016,IRAN.
17. Trauma Management from Islam View point., Mir Mah Press,2016,IRAN.
18. The new era of management,(Richard.L.Daft): Translated in Farsi By Dr.Sarlak , Gostareh,Press, 2008,IRAN.
==Research Works== He has published over one hundred scientific papers<ref>https://scholar.google.com/scholar?hl=en&q=mohammad+ali+sarlak&btnG=&as_sdt=1%2C5&as_sdtp=</ref> and directed more than 250 master's thesis<ref>http://www.pnu.ac.ir/portal/File/ShowFile.aspx?ID=c03b9522-22ea-4415-b7a1-7723a2951306</ref> and doctoral dissertations.<ref>http://www.pnu.ac.ir/portal/File/ShowFile.aspx?ID=807dafb9-c5bb-4619-95f1-2481a4ea89aa</ref>
==The concept of organization’s face == The concept of organization’s face represents something that identifies and distinguishes the organization from other similar organizations. This concept is based on tow underlying metaphors: # The organization as a natural system.<ref name=scott1998>Scott, W. Richard. (1998). ''Organizations: Rational, Natural, and Open Systems, 4th edn ''. Upper Saddle River, NJ: Prentice-Hall.</ref> # The organization as an organism<ref name=morgan2006>Morgan, Gareth. (2006). ''Images of Organization''. Newbury Park. CA: Sage Publications.</ref> The Organizations as living entity such as humans can be distinguished by face factor from each other. The question is what are the factors that determine an organization’s face? To answer this question, should be attention to pillars of an organization.<ref name="scott1998"/> Every organization has at least five following pillars.<ref name="scott1998"/> : # People # Goals # Structure # Technology # Environment
With an emphasis on each of the organizational pillars, a specific type of organization’s face is formed.Every organization can demonstrate five general face, simultaneously or separately: # Humanistic face # Goal oriented face # Structure oriented face # Technology based face # Environment based face Each of these faces is divided into more specific faces.
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Sarlak, Mohammad}} [[Category:Business theorists| List of business theorists]]

{{Advertisement|date=December 2017}} {{Infobox beverage |name = Pakola |bgcolor = blue |image = Pakola portfolio.png |type = [[Cola]] |abv = |proof = |origin = [[Pakistan]] |introduced = {{start date and age|14 August 1950}}[https://www.dawn.com/news/640414, 'Cult Pakistan: Part 1'], Dawn newspaper, Published 30 June 2011, Retrieved 30 March 2017 |discontinued = |colour = Green |flavour = Ice-cream Soda |variants = Pakola Fresh Lime
Pakola Orange
Pakola Raspberry
Pakola Ice-cream Soda
Pakola Lychee
|export = America
Africa
Australia
Afghanistan
Canada
Middle East
New Zealand
United Kingdom
|related = }} '''Pakola''', derived from '''Pakistan-Cola''' is a line of flavored carbonated [[soft drink]]s originating from [[Pakistan]]. It is produced and manufactured by '''Mehran Bottlers (Pvt.) Limited'''. ==Origin== [[Pakola]] was the creation of seven brothers from the [[Teli]] [[Family]] of Surat who migrated to [[Pakistan]] in [[1947]]. The idea of Pakola came from its founder [[Haji Ali Mohammad]] who had a dream to develop a drink that portrays the true reflection and taste of Pakistan. In order to pursue his dream, Haji Ali Mohammad opened a small factory with only two machines at the Lawrence Road (still known as Pakolagali) in Karachi with Pakola Ice-cream Soda being the initial product. The famous iconic drink Pakola was launched at the Pakistan Air Force Base on the day of Pakistan’s Independence, 14th August 1950, in the presence of the 1st Prime Minister of Pakistan, Liaquat Ali Khan. Since then, Pakola has made an enduring association between itself as a brand and the country. Later when [[Pakistan Beverages]] (PB) came into existence at SITE Karachi, the brand Pakola was produced there. In [[1979]] when Pakistan Beverages was announced as a production facility for [[PEPSI]], Mehran Bottlers (Pvt.) Limited came into existence and continued to produce the iconic drink Pakola along with other products like [[Apple Sidra]] and [[Bubble Up]]. Mehran Bottlers (Pvt.) Limited was managed by his nephews late Zafar Habib and Arif Habib. In 2004, Mehran Bottlers (Pvt.) Limited and Pakistan Beverages started manufacturing cans in Pakistan. Later in 2004, '''Zeeshan Z. Habib''' took charge as the '''Chief Executive Officer''' of Mehran Bottlers (Pvt.) Limited. Not only did he actively participate in all operational tasks but also learnt every aspect of it with keen interest and responsibility. He joined the family business soon after he graduated from The Manchester Metropolitan University. Mehran Bottlers (Pvt.) Limited is now among the few companies that are certified [[HALAL]], [[HACCP]], [[ISO]] and the [[FDA]]. Owning to his brilliant leadership, Pakola is one of the most successful brands in Pakistan. Pakola connects our hearts and minds with the national spirit, using the slogan '''“Dil Bola Pakola”'''. In [[2007]], with the exception of Karachi, the Teli family gave the franchise rights of Pakola to the Leghari family who previously owned Pepsi Sukkur. The Leghari family has the right to sell Pakola nationally with the exception of Karachi, while all exports are done from the Karachi plant. Pakola is one of the benchmark brands directly associated with the image of Pakistan. As per its slogan “Dil Bola Pakola”, Pakola is the heartbeat of the nation. Over the past 68 years, many [[beverages]] have been introduced in the local as well as the international market, but nothing could ever replace the taste, color and the iconic flavor of Pakola. Pakola still is the most preferred drink of Pakistani’s including those living abroad. For most people who grew up in the 80’s/90’s, Pakola evokes intense nostalgia whenever they see the brand. ==Brand Portfolio== Here is a list of several variants that have been introduced by Pakola: *''Pakola Ice Cream Soda {14th Aug 1950} - Company’s Trademark Product *''Pakola Orange'' {1985} *''Pakola Raspberry'' {1985} *''Pakola Lychee'' {1991} *''Pakola Fresh Lime'' {2006} *''Pakola Water'' {2015} *''Pakola Pomegranate'' {2016} ==Ingredients== Pakola is made with carbonated water, [[sugar]], [[citric acid]], Cream Soda Artificial Flavor, Color: FD&C Bleu No 1 (E 133), FD&C Yellow No.5 (E 102), Sodium Benzoate {as a preservative}. A typical can of Pakola (8.5 fl ounces/250 ml) has 33 g of sugar, 15 mg of sodium, 0 g of cholestrol, 0 g fat, 0 g of protien, and 130 calories. ==Production== Pakola is currently produced by two companies, Mehran Bottlers (Pvt) Limited and Gul Bottlers. ==Distribution== Pakola is now available in America, Africa, Australia, Canada, Middle East, New Zealand and the United Kingdom. It the only carbonated beverage manufactured in Pakistan that is exported globally. ==Glass Bottles== ==Discontinuation of the Glass Bottle== Due to the introduction of the capacity tax in 2013, Pakola discontinued the production and distribution of all glass-bottled products. The tax was levied on the overall production and distribution of the machinery instead of the actual output which made it an unfair system for those with lower productions or smaller markets. After the collapse of this system, Mehran Bottlers (Pvt.) Limited instantly set up their PET lines to grasp the market once again. ==Events== *Gulf Food Festival: One of the largest food, beverages and hospitality fair. The event attracts food and beverage industries and professionals to Dubai from all over the world. *Pakistan Single Country Exhibition in New Dehli: Pakola was a big hit among Indian consumers. *Saudi Agro Expo in Riyadh *Shan-e-Pakistan in India ==Campaigns & Advertising== '''To appeal the younger audience in terms of message and appearance, Pakola has revamped itself through different campaigns in recent years.''' *'''Pakistan’s 70th Indepence Day (2017-Limited Edition):''' By launching its Limited Edition Azaadi cans in 2017, Pakola celebrated freedom and joy with Pakistan. The cans paid tribute to Quaid-e-Azam Mohd Ali Jinnah, while they also showcased the flag of Pakistan and incorporated truck art peacock motif on the cans, thereby emphasizing the brand as being the drink of Pakistan. These cans had its own attraction and uniqueness defined amongst consumers which created a buzz throughout social media appreciating Pakistan and its existence. #PakolaAurPakistan #70thBirthday. *'''Celebrating Pakistani Culture (2018-Limited Edition):''' In 2018, Pakola launched its Limited Edition cans to celebrate Pakistani Culture. These cans depicited passion, craze, patriotism and love for Pakistan. Each can depicts its own story exhibiting the message of peace and harmony, beautifully potraying the Pakistani culture through truck art, sharing the love for folk music, displaying our favourite sport and honoring the Pakistan armed forces. *'''From Retro to Contemporary (TVC):''' A TVC was conceptualized on the theme from Retro to Contemporary. It takes you through a nostalgic journey from your early days to the present, portraying how old times have evolved but the taste, quality and fondness of Pakola has still remained the same. ==See Also== * [[Pepsi]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.pakola.com.pk/ Pakola website] {{Cream soda brands}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Pakola}} [[Category:Drink companies of Pakistan]] [[Category:Pakistani drinks]] [[Category:Products introduced in 1950]] [[Category:Cream sodas]] [[Category:Pakistani brands]] [[Category:Pakistani business culture]] {{food-product-stub}} {{Pakistan-cuisine-stub}}

revision.text:
'''Paul Roger Lawrence''' (April 26, 1922 – November 1, 2011) was an American sociologist, Professor of Organizational Behavior at the [[Harvard Business School]], and consultant, known from his work with [[Jay W. Lorsch]] on "Differentiation and integration in complex organizations."<ref>[[Galbraith, Jay R.]], and Daniel A. Nathanson. ''Strategy implementation: The role of structure and process.'' St. Paul, MN: West Publishing Company, 1978.</ref><ref>Evans, James Robert, and William M. Lindsay. ''The management and control of quality.'' (1996).</ref>
== Biography == Born in [[Rochelle, Illinois]], Lawrence obtained his AB from [[Albion College]] in 1943, and after the War at [[Harvard Business School]] his MBA in 1947 and his PhD in 1950.<ref name="PrL CV 2011">[http://prlawrence.com/memorial/cv/ CV: Paul R. Lawrence] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150128132219/http://prlawrence.com/memorial/cv/ |date=2015-01-28 }} at prlawrence.com. Accessed 24.01.2015</ref>
After graduation Lawrence started his lifelong academic career at Harvard University in 1947 as Instructor. He was appointed Assistant Professor in 1950, Associate Professor in 1956, and Full Professor in 1960. From 1967 to 1991 he was Wallace Brett Donham Professor of Organizational Behavior. He has been Visiting Professor at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 1973, and at the University of California, Berkeley in 1984. From 1975 to 1993 he has also been Director at [[Millipore Corporation]], and from 1991 to 1995 Director at the Hollingsworth & Vose Paper Company.<ref name="PrL CV 2011"/>
Lawrence was elected Fellow of the [[Academy of Management]], and of the International Academy of Management, and member of the [[American Sociological Association]] and the Society for the Advancement of Socio-Economics.
== Selected publications == * Turner, Arthur N., and Paul R. Lawrence. ''Industrial jobs and the worker.'' Harvard Univ., 1965. * Davis, S. M., Lawrence, P. R., Kolodny, H., & Beer, M. (1977). ''Matrix'' (Vol. 1115). Reading, MA: Addison-Wesley. * Lawrence, Paul R., and [[Jay W. Lorsch]]. ''Organization and Environment: Managing Differentiation and Integration.'' Harvard Business School Classics. (1986).
;Articles, a selection * Lawrence, Paul R., and [[Jay W. Lorsch]]. "Differentiation and integration in complex organizations." ''Administrative science quarterly'' (1967): 1-47. * Lawrence, Paul R., and [[Jay W. Lorsch]]. "Managing differentiation and integration." ''Organization and environment'' (1967). * Johnston, Russell, and Paul R. Lawrence. "Beyond vertical integration–the rise of the value-adding partnership." Thompson, G.(et al.)(Eds.), ''Markets, hierarchies and networks, The Coordination of Social Life,'' Sage, London (1991): 193-202.
== References == {{reflist}}
== External links == {{Wikiquote}} * [http://www.hbs.edu/news/releases/Pages/paullawrenceobituary110311.aspx Harvard Business School Professor Paul. R. Lawrence Dies at 89] * {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130115183051/http://prlawrence.com/memorial/bio/ |date=January 15, 2013 |title=Autobiography Paul Lawrence – Originally presented 4/14/07 }}
==Archives and records== *[http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:HBS.Baker.EAD:bak00194 Paul R. Lawrence papers] at Baker Library Special Collections, Harvard Business School.
{{Authority control}}

Robert Walton Goelet was not his father; he was his son
revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Robert Goelet | image = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = September 29, 1841 | birth_place = [[New York, New York]] | death_date = April 27, 1899 | death_place = [[Naples]], [[Italy]] | resting_place = | residence = | education = [[Columbia University|Columbia College]] | boards = [[Chemical National Bank]] | spouse = {{marriage|Harriette Louise Warren
|April 17, 1879|April 27, 1899|reason=his death}} | children = [[Robert Walton Goelet]]
Beatrice Goelet | parents = | relatives = ''See'' [[Goelet family]] | box_width = }} '''Robert Goelet''' (September 29, 1841 – April 27, 1899) was an American heir, businessman and yachtsman from [[New York City]] during the [[Gilded Age]]. ==Early life== Robert Goelet was born on September 29, 1841 in [[Manhattan]], New York City, to Sarah Ogden (1809–1888) and Robert Goelet (1809–1879).{{cite book|title=Genealogical Record of the Saint Nicholas Society: Advanced Sheets, First Series|date=1902|publisher=Saint Nicholas Society of the City of New York|location=New York City|page=28|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=_6Q-AAAAYAAJ&pg=PA28&lpg=PA28&dq=Sarah+Ogden+(1809%E2%80%931888)&source=bl&ots=go1K6bD0mS&sig=O9DChxjsyPB7EVDa4bCFxbJ8ekQ&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjkhLqEs87QAhXKg1QKHSF8BXMQ6AEIJjAC#v=onepage&q=Sarah%20Ogden%20(1809%E2%80%931888)&f=false|accessdate=29 November 2016|language=en}} He had a younger brother, [[Ogden Goelet]], who married society leader [[Mary Wilson Goelet]] and built [[Ochre Court]] in [[Newport, Rhode Island]]. Through his brother, he was the uncle of [[Mary Goelet]],{{cite news|last1=Times|first1=Wireless To The New York|title=DOWAGER DUCHESS OF ROXBURGHE DIES; New York Heiress Was a Close Friend of King George V and Queen Mary|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1937/04/27/archives/dowager-duchess-of-roxburghe-dies-new-york-heiress-was-a-close.html|accessdate=13 April 2017|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=27 April 1937}} who married [[Henry Innes-Ker, 8th Duke of Roxburghe]]{{cite news|title=THE ROXBURGHE WEDDING; Private Rehearsal Held at St. Thomas's Church. Programme of Today's Ceremony -- Simple Reception to Follow at the Goelet Residence -- Some of the Gifts.|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1903/11/10/archives/the-roxburghe-wedding-private-rehearsal-held-at-st-homass-church.html|accessdate=13 April 2017|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=10 November 1903}}{{cite news|title=MOTHER AND SISTER OF ROXBURGHE HERE; Duchess Denies Story of Objection to American Brides. Plans for the Wedding Complete -- The Decorations at the Church and Home of the Bride.|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1903/11/08/archives/mother-and-sister-of-roxburghe-here-duchess-denies-story-of.html|accessdate=13 April 2017|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=8 November 1903}} and real estate developer [[Robert Wilson Goelet]].{{cite web|last1=Foreman|first1=John|title=Big Old Houses: A Better Fate Than Many|url=http://www.newyorksocialdiary.com/the-way-they-live/2012/big-old-houses-a-better-fate-than-many|website=New York Social Diary|accessdate=29 November 2016|date=14 November 2012}} His parents resided at 5 State Street, overlooking the [[Battery Park|Battery]] in Manhattan. His father was a prominent landlord in New York, as was his uncle, Peter Goelet, who was named after his great-grandfather, [[Peter Goelet]]. ==Career== [[File:Robert Goelet House (3678096909).jpg|thumb|right|Goelet's residence in [[Newport, Rhode Island|Newport]]]] He graduated from [[Columbia University|Columbia College]] in 1860{{cite news|title=Columbia College Commencement.; INTERESTING EXERCISES--LIST OF THE GRADUATING CLASS.|url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1860/06/27/96039066.pdf|accessdate=29 November 2016|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=27 June 1860}} and was subsequently admitted to the bar. He managed the real estate of his father and his unmarried uncle. After their deaths, he inherited half their fortune. He also served on the Board of Directors of the Union Trust Company, the [[The Bank of New York Mellon|New York Life Insurance and Trust Company]], the [[J.P. Morgan & Co.|Guaranty Trust Company]], the Bank of New Amsterdam, the [[Chemical National Bank]], which his father and uncle were instrumental in founding. In his obituary in ''[[The New York Times]]'', he was described as:
"He was clear-headed and keen-witted, and his judgment in financial and real estate matters invariably commanded the respect of other business men. A loyal New Yorker, Robert Goelet took particular pride in promoting the growth and development of the city with which his family had long so long identified. He was a man of progressive ideas, and throughout his business career pursued a policy of improving his properties in a manner which would beautify the city."
===Social and sporting life=== Goelet was a member of the exclusive [[Philadelphia Club]], the [[New York Yacht Club]], the [[Knickerbocker Club]], the [[Metropolitan Club]], the [[Tuxedo Club]], the [[Union Club of the City of New York]] and was one of the original stockholders of the [[Metropolitan Opera House (39th Street)|Metropolitan Opera House]], both before it burned in 1892 and after it was rebuilt. He was also a member of the [[Jekyll Island Club]] on [[Jekyll Island, Georgia]]. His yacht ''Nahma'' was designed by [[George L. Watson]] and built for him on the [[River Clyde]] in 1897. After his death, it was used extensively for summer cruising in European waters by his son, [[Robert Walton Goelet]], who lent the yacht at no cost to the [[United States Navy]]. The Navy operated it as [[USS Nahma (SP-771)]] from 1917 to 1919, after which it was returned. ==Marriages and children== [[File:Beatrice Goelet.jpg|thumb|Goelet's daughter, Beatrice, by [[John Singer Sargent]], 1890]] On April 17, 1879, Goelet married Harriette Louise Warren (1854-1912) in New York City. Harriette was a daughter of George Henry Warren I, a prominent lawyer, and Mary ([[née]] Phoenix) Warren (herself the daughter of [[U.S. Representative]] [[Jonas P. Phoenix]] and granddaughter of [[Stephen Whitney]]). Harriet was the sister of stockbroker [[George Henry Warren II]]{{cite news |author= |coauthors= |title=George H. Warren ... A Founder of Concern That Once Owned Metropolitan Opera's Home, Dies at 87. Kin Of Noted Architect. Graduate of Columbia and Its Law School, but Never Had Practiced. Formerly Broker |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1943/06/04/archives/george-h-warreni-realtybxoff-ioial-a-founder-of-concern-that-once.html |quote=Warren's wife, Georgia ... Warren, died on Feb. 21, 1937. Surviving are a son, George Henry Warren, Jr.; a daughter, [[Constance Whitney Warren]], ... |work=[[New York Times]] |date=June 4, 1943 |accessdate=2010-07-25 }}{{cite book|last1=Weeks|first1=Lyman Horace|title=Prominent Families of New York: Being an Account in Biographical Form of Individuals and Families Distinguished as Representatives of the Social, Professional and Civic Life of New York City|date=1898|publisher=Historical Company|page=604|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=u45frgEACAAJ|accessdate=1 March 2018|language=en}} and prominent architects [[Whitney Warren]]{{cite news |title=WHITNEY WARREN, ARCHITECT, 78, DIES; Designer of the Grand Central Terminal and Rebuilding of Louvain Library, Belgium HAD PRACTICAL APPROACH Specialized With His Partner, C. D. Wetrnore. in Railroad Structures, Hotels, Offices |url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1943/01/25/85073653.html?pageNumber=13 |accessdate=13 July 2018 |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=January 25, 1943 |page=13 |language=en}} and [[Lloyd Warren]].{{cite news |author= |coauthors= |title=Sleep-Walk Plunge Kills Lloyd Warren; Famous Architect Falls From His Sixth-Floor Apartment in Early Morning. Suicide Theory Discarded. Victim Had Suffered From Somnambulism. Created BeauxArts Institute |url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B02E2DF1F39EF3ABC4E51DFB6678389639EDE |work=[[New York Times]] |date=October 26, 1922 |accessdate=2010-07-25 }} The Goelets resided in a townhouse located at 591 [[Fifth Avenue]] in Manhattan (designed by [[Edward H. Kendall]] in 1880), as well as at seasonal residences in [[Tuxedo Park, New York]], and [[Newport, Rhode Island]] (designed by [[McKim, Mead & White]], c. 1882-1883).{{cite news |last1=Miller |first1=Tom |title=The Lost Robert Goelet Mansion - No. 591 5th Avenue |url=https://daytoninmanhattan.blogspot.com/2011/05/lost-robert-goelet-mansion-no-591-5th.html |accessdate=19 September 2018 |work=Daytonian in Manhattan |date=3 May 2011}} Together, Harriette and Robert Goelet had two children: * [[Robert Walton Goelet]] (1880–1941), a financier and real estate developer.{{cite news |author= |coauthors= |title=Robert W. Goelet Dies In Home At 61. Corporation Director, Owner of Large Realty Holdings Here, Succumbs to Heart Attack. He Inherited $60,000,000. Sportsman, a Leader in Social Circles in Newport and New York, Kin of Early Settlers |url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1941/05/03/88099465.pdf |quote=Robert Walton Goelet of New York and Newport, R. I., a member of one of New York's oldest and wealthiest families, died of a heart attack yesterday at his ... |work=[[New York Times]] |date=May 3, 1941 |accessdate=2010-07-26 }}{{cite news |author= |coauthors= |title=Death Claims Robert Goelet Financier, 61. Outstanding Business Executive Was One of Largest Property Owners in New York City |url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/courant/access/862411922.html?dids=862411922:862411922&FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:AI&type=historic&date=May+03,+1941&author=&pub=Hartford+Courant&desc=Death+Claims+Robert+Goelet+Financier,+61&pqatl=google |quote=Robert Walton Goelet, 61, of New York and Newport, R. I., a financier and one of New York's largest property owners, died today in his old brownstone house at 48th Street and Fifth Avenue, one of the few remaining private residences on the... |work=[[Associated Press]] in the [[Hartford Courant]] |date=May 3, 1941 |accessdate=2010-07-26 }} * Beatrice Goelet (1885–1902), who died of pneumonia in 1902, aged 17.{{cite news |title=MISS BEATRICE GOELET DEAD. Only Daughter of the Late Robert Goelet Succumbs to Attack of Pneumonia. |url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1902/02/12/101935629.pdf |accessdate=19 September 2018 |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=February 12, 1902}} As a child, she was painted by [[John Singer Sargent]].{{cite book |last1=Simpson |first1=Marc |last2=Sargent |first2=John Singer |last3=Ormond |first3=Richard |last4=Weinberg |first4=Helene Barbara |last5=Institute |first5=Sterling and Francine Clark Art |title=Uncanny Spectacle: The Public Career of the Young John Singer Sargent |date=1997 |publisher=[[Yale University Press]] |isbn=0300071779 |page=27 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=-nFsM8EMjQEC&pg=PA27 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |language=en}} He died of heart disease on April 27, 1899, in [[Naples]], [[Italy]].{{cite news |title=DEATH OF ROBERT GOELET {{!}} Heart Disease Causes the End Unexpectedly at Naples. {{!}} CAREER OF THE MILLIONAIRE {{!}} His Public Spirit and Benevolence Were of Material Benefit to New York and Newport. |url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1899/04/28/102532197.pdf |accessdate=19 September 2018 |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=April 28, 1899}} After his body was transported from Italy by his yacht ''Nahma'', his funeral was held at [[Trinity Church (Newport, Rhode Island)|Trinity Church]] in Newport. After the funeral, his body was again transported "by special train over the [[New Haven Railroad|New Haven Road]]", and was buried in the Goelet Mausoleum, which had been completed only days before, at [[Woodlawn Cemetery, Bronx|Woodlawn Cemetery]] in the [[Bronx]].{{cite news|title=FUNERAL OF ROBERT GOELET.; Service at Trinity Church, Newport, Attended by Many Cottagers--Burial at Woodlawn Cemetery.|url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1899/05/28/117923431.pdf|accessdate=29 November 2016|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=28 May 1899}} His widow lived for another 13 years until her death in December 1912 at her home in Paris, 46 [[Avenue d'Iéna]].{{cite news |title=MRS. ROBERT GOELET DIES IN PARIS HO[E Prominent American Hostess's Death Follows an Operation for Cancer. {{!}} BODY TO BE BROUGHT HERE {{!}} Entertained German Emporer on Her Yacht Nahma--History of Goelet Real Estate Fortune |url=https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1912/12/05/100562641.pdf |accessdate=19 September 2018 |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=December 5, 1912}} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *{{fg|92105450}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Goelet, Robert}} [[Category:1841 births]] [[Category:1899 deaths]] [[Category:Goelet family]] [[Category:Businesspeople from New York City]] [[Category:Businesspeople in real estate]] [[Category:Members of the New York Yacht Club]] [[Category:Burials at Woodlawn Cemetery (Bronx)]]

{{About|the French mobile phone company}} {{Use dmy dates|date=March 2016}} {{Infobox company | name = SFR | logo = Logo SFR 2014.svg | logo_size = 150px | type = [[S.A. (corporation)|Société anonyme]] | founder = | location = | location_city = Paris | location_country = France | locations = | area_served = France, Réunion, [[Mayotte]], Belgium, Luxembourg, Guadeloupe, [[Martinique]] | key_people = Michel Combes (Chairman and CEO){{cite web|title=Management team|url=http://www.sfr.com/nous-connaitre/discover-sfr/management-team|publisher=SFR|accessdate=2 May 2016}} | industry = [[Telecommunications]] | genre = | products = Box de SFR, Home by SFR, mobile phones | services = [[Internet service provider|Fixed-line internet]], mobile internet, [[Landline|fixed-line]] and [[Mobile phone|mobile telephony]], [[IPTV|IP television]] | revenue = €12.577 billion{{cite web |url=http://www.sfr.com/nous-connaitre/lessentiel-2010/chiffres-cles |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2011-08-01 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110706221207/http://www.sfr.com/nous-connaitre/lessentiel-2010/chiffres-cles |archivedate=6 July 2011 |df=dmy-all }} | operating_income = €12.183 billionhttp://www.sfr.com/nous-connaitre (2011) | net_income = €2.472 billion (2010) | owner = [[Altice (company)|Altice]] | num_employees = 14,500 | parent = SFR Group | divisions = | subsid = Joe Mobile | footnotes = | foundation = February 1987 | homepage = {{URL|sfr.fr}}
{{URL|sfr.lu}}
{{URL|sfr.be}}
{{URL|sfr.re}}
{{URL|sfrcaraibe.fr}} }} '''SFR''' ''(Société française du radiotéléphone)'' is a French telecommunications company that provides voice, video, data, and Internet telecommunications and professional services to consumers and businesses. As of December 2015, it has 21.9 million customers in Metropolitan France for mobile services, and provides 6.35 million households with high-speed internet access.{{cite web |url=http://www.nextinpact.com/news/99052-numericable-sfr-regagne-enfin-clients-sur-marche-mobile.htm | title= Numericable-SFR regagne enfin des clients sur le marché mobile}} Nextimpact.com, 15 March 2016 SFR is owned by [[Altice (company)|Altice]] and French conglomerate [[Vivendi]]. SFR also offers services in the Overseas Departments of France : in the Caribbean islands of [[Martinique]], [[Guadeloupe]], and in [[Guyane]] as well as in the Indian Ocean, in [[Mayotte]] and on the [[Réunion]] island through '''SRR''' (''Société Réunionnaise du Radiotéléphone'') although the company is branded as ''SFR Réunion''. SFR (SFR Belux) operated in Belgium as a cable operator and MVNO in some communes of [[Brussels Region]] and in some areas of [[Luxembourg]]. The division was sold to rival [[Telenet (Belgium)|Telenet]] in December 2016. ==History== [[Vodafone]] had a 44% share in SFR until April 2011 when it sold the entire share back to [[Vivendi]]. SFR is a major partner network of Vodafone in France.{{cite web |url=http://www.vodafone.com/content/index/media/vodafone-group-releases/2014/vodafone-sfr.html |title=Vodafone and SFR strengthen strategic global alliance}} Vodafone.com, 7 May 2014{{cite web |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2014-04-05/vivendi-agrees-to-sell-sfr-to-altice-in-23-billion-deal.html |title=Vivendi Selling SFR to Altice in $23 Billion Deal, Hard-Fought Win for Drahi}} bloomberg.com, 7 April 2014 Vivendi announced in March 2014 that it planned to sell its SFR division.[http://www.lepoint.fr/chroniqueurs-du-point/guerric-poncet/rachat-de-sfr-vivendi-choisit-numericable-14-03-2014-1801197_506.php lepoint.fr: 'Numericable-SFR : "l'avenir commence aujourd'hui"' 14 Mar 2014] On 14 March it announced that it would enter exclusive negotiations with Altice/[[Numericable]], to the exclusion of [[Bouygues]] and [[Free (ISP)|Iliad]]. [[Arnaud Montebourg]], the French Minister for Industrial Renewal, provoked a storm when he stated that the Numericable/SFR deal was a certainty; Iliad lost 7.5% of its market value on that day. In February 2016 [[Orange S.A.|Orange]], SFR and [[Free Telecom|Free]] announced the purchase of their competitor [[Bouygues Telecom]]. However, negotiations for the purchase agreement fell through a few months later.[http://www.europe1.fr/economie/echec-des-negociations-pour-la-vente-de-bouygues-telecom-a-orange-2708965 europe1.fr: 'Échec des négociations pour la vente de Bouygues Telecom à Orange' 1 April 2016] ==Slogans== *1987-1990: « Parce qu’un abonné SFR n’est pas qu’un simple numéro » *1990-1994: « Ligne SFR, Le téléphone liberté » *1994-1996: « SFR, Le monde sans fil est à vous » *1996-1999: « Sans fil SFR, le monde est à vous » *1999-2000: « Vous n'avez pas fini d'être LIBRE » *2000-2001: « SFR, le meilleur réseau » *2001-2003: « Vous serez toujours plus qu’un simple numéro » *2003-2005: « Plus de plaisir » *2005-2007: « Parlons mieux, parlons mobile » *2007-2008: « Vivons mobile » *2008-2010: « SFR, et le monde est à vous » *2010-2014: « Carrément vous » *2014-2015: « Smart comme vous » *2015-2016: « SFR, et tout s'accélère » *2016-2017: « #NewSFR » *2017: «Pour vous, SFR change» ==SFR TV== SFR TV is a television service accessible on ''La box de SFR'' and ''La Box Fibre de SFR'', which delivers television programs via the broadband internet telephone network ([[xDSL]]), high-speed internet ([[FTTH]] or [[FTTB]] fiber within [[Numericable]]). The service was also broadcast by satellite with ''SFR Sat'' available on the [[Astra 19.2°E]] satellite until October 2015. The SFR TV package includes more than 200 channels, some [[pay-tv]] channels can be added as an option, by subscribing to a specific paid package, classified by theme (sport, youth, music, international ...). ==SFR Sport== SFR Sport is a package of French TV channels ([[SFR Sport 1]], [[SFR Sport 2]], [[SFR Sport 3]], [[SFR Sport 4K]], [[SFR Sport 5]]) from the SFR Group devoted to sports. They are available for SFR and [[Over-the-top content|OTT]] subscribers. ==See also== {{Portal|Companies}} *[[Communications in France]] ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== * [http://www.sfr.fr/ SFR France] * [http://www.sfr.com/ Corporate website] * [http://www.sfr.re/ SFR Reunion] * [http://www.sfr.yt/ SFR Mayotte] * [http://www.sfr.be/ SFR Belgium] * [http://www.sfr.lu/ SFR Luxembourg] * [http://www.sfrcaraibe.fr/ SFR Caraïbe] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20061106100645/http://www.sfrjeunestalents.fr/ SFR Jeunes Talents – SFR's initiative to help promote and discover new talents on mobile and web] {{French mobile phone companies}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sfr}} [[Category:Telecommunications companies of France]] [[Category:Mobile phone companies of France]] [[Category:Multinational companies headquartered in France]] [[Category:Internet service providers of France]] [[Category:French brands]] [[Category:French business families]] [[Category:Telecommunications companies established in 1987]] [[Category:1987 establishments in France]] [[Category:Former Vivendi subsidiaries]]

revision.text:
{{pp-move-indef}} {{Use mdy dates|date=May 2017}} {{Infobox Aircraft occurrence |Name = United Express Flight 3411 incident |image = N632RW (8025014026).jpg |caption = N632RW, at [[Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport]] in 2012. |Date = April 9, 2017 |Type = Forcible passenger removal |occurrence_type = Incident |Site = [[O'Hare International Airport]], [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]] |Passengers = 70 |Injuries = 1 |Crew = |aircraft_name = |Aircraft Type = [[Embraer 170]] |Tail Number = N632RW |Origin = [[O'Hare International Airport]] |Stopover = |Destination = [[Louisville International Airport]] |Operator = [[Republic Airline]] dba [[United Express]] }} On April 9, 2017, [[O'Hare International Airport]] Aviation Security Officers forcibly removed passenger '''David Dao''', a [[Pulmonology|pulmonologist]], from [[United Express]] Flight 3411, after Dao refused to leave the aircraft as airline staff insisted. Aviation Security Officers were called and dragged him off. Dao screamed as officers pulled him out of his seat, and his face hit an armrest during the struggle. Officers then dragged him, apparently unconscious, by his arms on his back along the aircraft aisle past rows of onlooking passengers.<ref name="nyt1" /> According to passenger eyewitness accounts, the Aviation Security Officers laughed as Dao was dragged off the plane.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://nypost.com/2017/04/13/cop-laughed-as-man-was-dragged-off-flight-witness/|title=Cop laughed as man was dragged off flight: witness|author=Natalie Musumeci|date=April 13, 2017|website=nypost.com|accessdate=September 11, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/united-passenger-cops-laughed-dragged-doc-flight-article-1.3051239|title=United passenger claims cops laughed as they dragged Kentucky doctor off flight|first=Terence|last=Cullen|date=April 13, 2017 |website=nydailynews.com|accessdate=September 11, 2018}}</ref> He was later seen with blood around his mouth. Prior to the confrontation, managers offered travel vouchers to passengers to vacate their seats to make room for four airline employees who needed to travel to the destination, [[Louisville International Airport]], but none of the passengers accepted. Four passengers were then selected for involuntary removal from the flight. Three other passengers complied, and Dao was selected to be fourth. [[Republic Airline]] operated the scheduled passenger flight on behalf of United Express, a [[United Airlines]] regional branch.
Video of the incident recorded by passengers went [[viral video|viral]] on [[social media]], resulting in outrage over the violent incident. Politicians expressed concern and called for official investigation. [[U.S. President]] [[Donald Trump]] criticized United Airlines, calling treatment of their customer "horrible".
The next morning United [[CEO]] [[Oscar Munoz (executive)|Oscar Munoz]] issued a statement which appeared to justify the [[involuntary deboarding|removal]] of the unwilling passenger, referring to it as "re-accommodating the customers".<ref>[http://newsroom.united.com/news-releases?item=124753 Response to United Express Flight 3411], April 10, 2017</ref> Munoz also sent an email to United staff commending the crew's actions for following established procedures, and referring to Dao as "disruptive" and "belligerent".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/04/14/business/united-airlines-passenger-doctor.html|title=United's Apologies: A Timeline|first=Erin|last=Mccann|date=April 14, 2017|publisher=|via=NYTimes.com}}</ref> The description of Dao as "disruptive" and "belligerent" completely contradicted passenger descriptions of the incident. Passenger Jason Powell said Dao was not belligerent, saying, "He was very polite, matter-of-fact,"<ref name="mic.com">{{cite web|url=https://mic.com/articles/174007/united-airlines-new-video-suggests-dr-david-dao-was-not-belligerent-before-removal|title=United Airlines: New video suggests Dr. David Dao was not "belligerent" before removal|author=Stacey Leasca|date=April 12, 2017|website=mic.com|accessdate=September 11, 2018}}</ref><ref name="courier-journal.com">{{cite web|url=https://www.courier-journal.com/story/news/2017/04/11/male-hs-teacher-aboard-united-flight-didnt-need-happen/100319308/|title=Male H.S. teacher aboard United flight: 'This didn't need to happen'|author=Bailey Loosemore|date=April 11, 2017|website=courier-journal.com|accessdate=September 11, 2018}}</ref> In addition, cell phone video by passenger Joya Cummings also contradicted Munoz' description of Dao as belligerent.<ref name="mic.com"/>
Munoz and United were sharply criticized for their initial statements. Two days after the incident Munoz issued an additional statement,<ref>[http://newsroom.united.com/news-releases?item=124755 Statement from United Airlines CEO Oscar Munoz on United Express Flight 3411], April 11, 2017</ref> apologizing and promising that this type of incident would never happen again on United aircraft. He said, "No one should ever be mistreated this way." In an exclusive interview on ''Good Morning America'', with ABC News Chief Business, Technology and Economics correspondent, [[Rebecca Jarvis]], Munoz was asked, "Do you think [Dao] was at fault in any way?" Munoz responded, "No. He can't be. He was a paying passenger sitting on our seat in our aircraft."<ref>{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=90jSUe_vdhM|title=United Airlines CEO Oscar Munoz - INTERVIEW after passenger dragged off flight|first=|last=ABC News|date=April 12, 2017|publisher=|accessdate=January 25, 2018|via=YouTube}}</ref> Munoz was denied a previously planned promotion to chairman as a result of the incident.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" /> Dao reached an "amicable" settlement with United on April 27, the terms of which were not publicly announced.<ref name="Dao settles--Fox">{{cite news|last1=McCarthy|first1=Sky|title=United passenger dragged off flight settles with airline for undisclosed amount|url=http://www.foxnews.com/travel/2017/04/27/dragged-united-passenger-settles-with-airline-for-undisclosed-amount.html|accessdate=April 27, 2017|work=Fox News|date=April 27, 2017}}</ref><ref name="Dao settles--BBC">{{cite news|title=Passenger dragged off United Airlines plane wins settlement|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-39739737|accessdate=April 27, 2017|work=BBC News|date=April 27, 2017}}</ref>
{{TOC limit|3}}
